Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    class to model an m x n matrix and supports Gaussian row operations
    In this version, rows and columns start at 0
    Version:
    2-15-06
    Author:
    csc 142

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Matrix()
      Instantiate a 3 x 4 matrix, empty
      Matrix(int m, int n)
      Instantiate an m x n matrix, empty

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addRows(int r1, int r2)
      add row r1 into row r2.
      void display()
      Display the matrix to System.out
      int getColCount()
      returns the number of columns in this matrix
      int getRowCount()
      returns the number of rows in this matrix
      double getValue(int row, int col)
      returns the value of a particular element in the matrix
      void interchangeRows(int r1, int r2)
      interchange 2 rows of this matrix
      void multiplyRow(double multiple, int row)
      multiply one row by a non-zero constant
      void setValue(int row, int col, double value)
      set the value of a particular element in the matrix

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix

        public Matrix()
        Instantiate a 3 x 4 matrix, empty

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(int m,
      int n)
        Instantiate an m x n matrix, empty
        Parameters:
        m - number of rows
        n - number of columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either parameter <=0

    • Method Detail

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int row,
            int col,
            double value)
        set the value of a particular element in the matrix
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the element. 0 <= row < getRowCount()
        col - the column of the element. 0 <= col < getColCount()
        value - the value to be stored
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if row or col is illegal

      • getValue

        public double getValue(int row,
              int col)
        returns the value of a particular element in the matrix
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the element. 0 <= row < getRowCount()
        col - the column of the element. 0 <= col < getColCount()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if row or col is illegal

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        returns the number of rows in this matrix

      • getColCount

        public int getColCount()
        returns the number of columns in this matrix

      • interchangeRows

        public void interchangeRows(int r1,
                   int r2)
        interchange 2 rows of this matrix
        Parameters:
        r1 - one of the rows to swap. 0 <= r1 < getRowCount()
        r2 - the other row to swap. 0 <= r2 < getRowCount()
        Throws:
        IllegalArguementException - for bad arguments

      • multiplyRow

        public void multiplyRow(double multiple,
               int row)
        multiply one row by a non-zero constant
        Parameters:
        multiple - the non-zero constant
        row - the row to change
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bad arguments

      • addRows

        public void addRows(int r1,
           int r2)
        add row r1 into row r2.
        Parameters:
        r1 - the row to add
        r2 - the row to add to. This row will change.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - for bad rows

      • display

        public void display()
        Display the matrix to System.out
